turns.text: 39   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Back against the bars.  Now.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: How long have you been up north?

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Six months.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Can't be.  Too keen a sense of this place in your pictures.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: My dad was a Navy doctor.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Knew you had no native blood, even with your dark hair.  Blue eyes give you away.  My wife had blue eyes.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Had?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: She's dead.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Had some good years.  Met her in '66.  She showed up one day in Coldfoot.  No one knew her.  One Sunday morning, she marched into a bar and announced she was available as a wife to the highest bidder.  Didn't work out in three months, she'd return the money and leave, no hard feelings.  My bid was eight thousand dollars.  Beautiful girl.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: How did she..?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I was gone, in September, laying traplines.  She went to our cache for some meat.  Got mauled by a bear.  Tore open her skull. -more-

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: What about you -- why come back? Classy girl like you seems more suited to the finer things.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: That's why I left, moved to Washington.  When I met Eric I was doing day shoots -- products and fashion, mostly.  Pretty dull.  Eric was teaching college, and then he got the job with Northland Oil.  We wanted to stay together, so we talked them into funding some wilderness photography... and here I am.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You should know something.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: I don't want to talk any more.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Wasn't my intention to hurt Wilder.  I'm telling you the truth.  I liked the man.  I only meant to get loose... to survive. Your cheechako boyfriend better understand that.  Listen, I've got some money put away --

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Have you talked to Eric?

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: I have not, but I very much want to.  What do you know about the trouble in Devil's Cauldron?

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: I was hoping you had some news --

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: -- Get this straight: I'm the District Supervisor.  Whatever you do reflects on me.  It wasn't my idea to bring you people up here, but I'm stuck with you. You are absolutely not to involve yourself in any local disputes. Whichever side you take, you alienate the other.  Mr. Corbett is quite well-known in this region.  People admire him --

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: -- Corbett's a killer.

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: What happened here?

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: The radio's on the fritz.

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: Where'd you say Eric is?

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Somewhere along the pipeline.

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: What about that hotheaded marshal, Sam Wilder?  I heard he was in the middle of this mess.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Sam?  We haven't seen him.

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: Really.  I thought maybe that was his snowmobile outside.  By the way -- your truck also 'on the fritz?'

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: It's out by the pumping station, shot full of holes.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: He's coming around fine.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Be right back.  I left my camcorder in the car.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: He still might be around.  I saw fresh tire tracks coming in.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Stay here.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Be careful -- there're two of them.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Great idea -- pointing a lousy dart gun at some nut with a high-powered hunting rifle.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Bastards took off, though, didn't they?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: I bet you haven't had lunch.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: I call it 'the Turtle,' as in carrying your home on your back.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Best thing is, Meyerling has to chase around to find us.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: The little creep hates it that Eric actually does what the company hired him to do.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I'll go into town with you.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Eric, leave it alone.  It's not your business.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: No way can he get away with this. I'll be back by tonight.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Did you catch Corbett?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Sure did.  He was one of the trappers we rousted from the Haul Road.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Was there any trouble?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: He was sitting in a hot tub with a hooker.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Going after killers isn't the same as chasing poachers, Eric.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Can't help myself.  Corbett's type always pisses me off.  Oh, I found this at the post office.  Had your name on it.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Oh, sweetheart.  It's beautiful!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You were looking at it in the catalog.  Don't know where you can wear it...

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: I'll wear it for you.  And I can wear it when we go home.  We won't be here forever.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You make it sound like a prison sentence.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: That's not what I meant.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: It's exactly what you meant.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Look, why get into this again. As long as it's working, let's leave it alone.  It's been nice so far.  We're together --

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: -- Permanently?

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Do I want to be with you permanently?  Yes, I think I do. But be with what you do and the way you live?  That I don't know. C'mon, Eric, until I met you, coming back to Alaska was totally

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: I still can't believe I'm being financed by an oil company. Especially when they get a look at these pictures.  Technology in the wilderness; not too pretty.  What's that?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I thought I should check our emergency transmitters.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Winter.  Two straight months of night -- we may never get out of bed.  Which would suit me fine.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Prolonged darkness makes people crazy.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Not me.  I'm equipped.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: High-tech in the wilderness. Gets me excited, too.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Come here...

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Wait a second.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Maybe you should drive him into Devil's Cauldron, let them decide what to do with him.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Fairbanks is a three-hour flight. I'll be back by dinnertime.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Be careful, okay?

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: That's my line.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Oh, Christ, sweetheart.  Four days!  I thought you were dead, or worse.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You can't stay here.  Go back to the Turtle.  I'll meet you back there in a few hours.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I'll tell you everything later.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Where's Corbett?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Here.  A transport plane is due at eleven.  Once I put him on it, it's all over.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: So what's the problem?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Please, Anne Marie, you being here only complicates things.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: I'm staying.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: You're hurt.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Nothing broken.  C'mon, we have to hurry.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: Technology in the wilderness. Only problem is talking to you on your way to the landing strip.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I've got an idea.  We'll have to work fast.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: When you ran off, I thought you'd keep going 'til you were back home in Washington.

turns.speaker: ANNE MARIE
turns.text: My home is here.  With you.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Leave it here.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Let's keep going.  We're only an hour from Devil's Cauldron.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Relax.  I just want to ask them how the hunting is.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Had no choice...  ...Given the situation.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: I know.  Least you didn't shoot all of them.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Go ahead.  Take the jeep.  I'll come to Cache with Bob when he gets here.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Okay by me.  You're the one likes these hot springs so much.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Leave my traps.  We'll tag up, couple days.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You got two counts against you -- trapping out of season and poaching on restricted land.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Can't be much of a crime, if all they got minding the area is a cocky kid.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I got your plate number, asshole. Maybe you feel like spending a few months in jail.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Ben Corbett?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Yep.  Afraid you have me at a disadvantage.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Kenai at the general store asked me to bring these.  Didn't expect we'd already met.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: No big deal.  We just got off on the wrong foot.  What's your name?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Desmond.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: New to the country, kid?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Six months.  Ecological study for Northland Oil.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Ecology.  Folks use that term for everything but what it means: who's eating who.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Nice bluff the other day with the tranquilizer gun out your jeep window.  See you again, maybe.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Yeah.  Maybe so.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: A lot to ask, dragging him away from such a good-looking girl --

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: -- To take you to jail?  It'll be my pleasure.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Does he have people?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: A daughter in Oregon.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Send him down to her.  There's money in my duffel bag, back at his cabin.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Surviving is what I know --

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: -- Killing is what you know.  Pack some food while I prep for the flight.  I'm sure not gonna let him go.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: How the hell were they smart enough to find us?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Smart?  Sure.  That's why I'm sitting in this plane and they're down there blowing me kisses.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Been driving long?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I needed a pilot's license to take the job here, so I got one in six weeks.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: That makes the flight more interesting.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Sounds like professional jealousy.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Hunting and trapping was a damn fine life.  Me and Mitchell, Bob and LeMalle, we were teams.  I'd always go with Mitchell.  Good man, Mitchell.  I'd let Bob worry about goddamn LeMalle.  We'd hire a plane in October.  On the way to a dirt airstrip somewhere, we'd drop supplies.  We'd land, tell the pilot to come back for us a few days before Christmas.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Stay put!

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You got the belly to look me in the eye and pull the trigger?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Next time you want to kill yourself, don't include me.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I took the odds on getting down in one piece, and I made it.  Now we're in my territory.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: With light clothing and no supplies, this is nobody's territory.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You sound like the tourists. Know-it-alls who read about survival in a magazine.  Fuck you.  You won't make it off this mountain.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I'm not gonna carry you out of here.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: That's right.  You're not.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Look, take these cuffs off.  We need to work together.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Why in hell you care enough about me to die taking me in?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I don't plan on dying.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: We'll stop here, dig out a snow shelter.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Snow shelter.  Okay.  You dig. I'll have a little sit-down.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Still quite a hike to Devil's Cauldron.  Days.  A long stretch to go without sleep, my friend.  You can hide behind that pistol for now, but take your eyes off me long enough to sneeze --

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: -- Turn around.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Ice is too thin -- you can see the water moving underneath.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: We're not sitting here 'til November.  There's a cargo plane coming to Devil's Cauldron in four days, and I'm putting you on it.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: We get wet, we freeze to death in a couple hours.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I've been on ice like this when I was a kid, skating.  Spread your weight, keep moving.  Go on.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Be my guest.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I'm right behind you.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Most dangerous thing in the world: A regular Joe, in over his head.  You trying to prove how tough you are for me, or for yourself?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: It wasn't my idea to crash the plane.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Let's camp.  There's grayling under this ice. I'll snare some for dinner.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: We've got another two hours of daylight.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Pushing it is flat wrong.  All you prove is your ignorance about breaking trail.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Have to backtrack, find another way down.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Forget it.  It would take days.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Going to be a bit of a challenge with handcuffs on.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Damn lucky this storm didn't blow down when we were on those baldheaded mountains.  It continues, we better stay put.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: It could blow over tomorrow, too.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I'm still figuring: You're either real brave or real dumb.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Where in hell Meyerling dig you up?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You know Meyerling?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Sure.  The People's Friend.  Kiss your ass with precision if there's a vote in it.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Sure love to know where you fit in up here.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I'm here to do my job.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You want to fool yourself about that bullshit job, fine.  Damn shame you have to drag your girlfriend along.  You think a woman like that will be happy making moose stew for a man -more-

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Folks come to Alaska for a real short list of reasons:  Money. Adventure.  Solitude.  Those cover most everyone.  But frontiers also draw another type of man.  One with a demon in his gut.  He comes to the edge of the world to face that demon, and lay it to rest.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Yep.  Sometimes they do, but usually they end up crazy or dead.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: There's a cabin, maybe twenty miles south of here.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Too bad we're heading west.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: There's a snowmobile. Inside a day we could be on the Yukon.  I got money there.  Remember that five thousand?  Make it ten.  Be smart.  Take it and walk away.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You don't get it, do you?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Have to get these wet things off.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You're not going to slow us down! Keep moving!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Stay awake!  You want to go hypothermic?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: If that means freeze my balls off, no thanks.  I'll be okay.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Told you I'm fine!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: How many do you see?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: What?!  Fuck off.  Save yourself.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You don't feel cold?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: It's a spring day...

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Stay still.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Where's my ELT?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Emergency transmitter?  All your gear is back at Wilder's.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You got one?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: It was blown up with the plane.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Too bad.  We'd be out of here in a few hours.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I'm hungry.  Go kill me some dinner.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: An appetite.  Maybe you won't die after all.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Hate to disappoint you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Nome?  I figure you'd be a whaler, coming from there.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Told that's what our old man was. Planned on going to sea, me and Bob, 'til I read Jack London. Started trapping when I was ten. Mailed the furs to Sears.  Eight bucks for a skunk, three for a muskrat.  That was fine money.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Killing wildlife not good enough anymore, so you go on to bigger and better things.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You got a knack for seeing things the way you want to see them.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Don't judge me.  You're a joke, coming here from a fucked-up culture, telling us what to do!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Yeah, it is fucked up -- but it's not too late to keep that from happening here.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: All you do is keep folks from working the land, living like they're meant to.  You don't understand shit!  Trappers, hunters -- we're part of the environment.  Who's protecting us?  I've seen plenty like you.  So -more-

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: What do you know about people? You live like an animal!  A savage goddamn throwback like you belongs out here, as far away from the rest of us as possible.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I'm real sad you don't approve of me.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Don't push me..!

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Cowardly bastard.  I'm in handcuffs and I still scare the piss out of you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: They think you're in Fairbanks. If not, they still won't find you before the plane comes tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Don't bet on it.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I already have.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You don't know how true that is.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Maybe...maybe not.  I'll tell you what scares me -- stumbling through life, like an ordinary jerk.  That's why I want to work on the front lines, where what I do means something.  Soon as I got here, I realized my job was bullshit.  Oil company propaganda.  I was ready to leave, then I thought screw it, I'll outsmart them, do the work anyway.  I don't know anymore.  Maybe I am fooling myself.  That's what I'm afraid of most of all.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Hell, I still get a knot in my gut every season, wondering how much longer I can go on.  No 'Home for Retired Trappers' that -more-

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Talk to that good-looking girl of yours?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You broke the radio, remember?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I'm sure she's fine.  Seemed like a clever kid.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You were real resourceful out there.  Got me thinking of this perimeter man, froze all his fingers one winter.  So he hacked the tips off and sharpened the exposed bones.  Gets along better than ever.  Yeah, maybe I underestimated you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I liked you better frozen.  You didn't talk so much.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You're damn lucky, glimpsing this country before it's ruined, gone for good.  You saw wonders you'd only dreamed of.  That alone makes you different than the sorry bastards back where you came from, because you have dreamt them.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Emergency transmitter?  What happened to signal mirrors or two-tone smoke fires?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Lets us watch each other's backs over a wide area.  Only thing messed me up this time was getting arrested in the baths. ELT was in my duffel bag, not around my neck where it should've been.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: No way they'll find you on a five-minute signal.  And no way -more-

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Maybe you can talk sense into your boyfriend.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Answer and I'll shoot!

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You kill me, you sign your death warrant.  And hers.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Snow's to their advantage, kid. You can't see them, but soon as that plane comes, they'll sure as hell know where we're going. Wise up.  Take me to the Yukon. I'll give you that money and guarantee you'll walk away.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Why offer a buyoff with your gunmen waiting outside?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: The time has passed for men like them and me.  I know it.  But they're still fighting for survival, like cornered animals. That's why they'll kill you. -more-

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Can you walk?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Wound's a through-and-through. Missed my liver, I think.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: How come you didn't let him shoot me?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Like I said, I'd still be up on that mountain, frozen solid, it wasn't for you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: We'll get you to a hospital, soon as we get to Fairbanks.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Look down there, tell me what any of this matters.  Struggles of men get swallowed by the bigness. Soon there won't be a trace of our troubles... or us.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You're wrong.  Everything we do leaves its mark.  You said it yourself -- there are hundred- year-old footprints in the tundra.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Hullo, Sam.  Slow day?

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Ben...boys.  Yeah, real slow, and I'd like to keep it that way.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Just passing through.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Relax.  One more day without drink won't kill you.  Right, Sam?

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: I'm living proof of that sad fact.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Can we buy the Marshal some dinner?

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: No, I better stay at my post.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You wouldn't shoot anyone...

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: But I would.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: All this for laying traps on private land?

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: You left a footprint at the Sportsmen's camp.  Only pretty sight there, Ben, 'cause the two men you didn't shoot and mutilate died of exposure.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Christ if I shouldn't know better than to step in soft earth.  I've seen footprints in the tundra a hundred years old.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: I got it from here.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Sam, give Dixie here fifty bucks out of my kit, will you?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Sam, listen -- I shot to defend my man.  Other guy drew first.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: If that was all, fine.  But carving him up, stranding the others, that's too fucking much. Is everything that walks, crawls, flies or swims fair game to you?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I'll get loose before that plane comes.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Don't try me.  I'll kill you if it comes to it.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: You better get some sleep.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Good idea.  Flying over mountains can give you some nasty surprises.  Go too low, one of the clouds might have a big rock inside it.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Goddammit, I don't need this aggravation.  I'll shoot you, Ben.  Bank on it.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: I don't want to hurt you, Sam.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: I'm not too old to knock the snot out of you!

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Nothing personal.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I need to rent a cabin.

turns.speaker: KENAI
turns.text: What's the problem with Sam Wilder's place?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Will you rent me a cabin, or not?

turns.speaker: KENAI
turns.text: Pretty clever:  If the trappers got that signal beacon and get here in time, Sam's is the first place they'll look.  They may figure you're waiting for an airplane, so you can't stay in the shack by the airstrip.  Last place they'd expect you is on the far side of town.  I can't afford any trouble --

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: -- Here's a hundred dollars.  And if you or anyone else will back me up on this --

turns.speaker: KENAI
turns.text: -- Forget it.  And try not to bleed on my throw rugs.  Why do this?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: If you have to ask, you wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Mr. Desmond!  Arthur Neff.  Area rep for the Federal Assistance Plan.  Tell the boys in DC to keep those goodies coming.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Snowplow, generator, TV dish... hell, we get the goddamn Playboy Channel!  Here, this is for you.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: You don't mind me saying, Mr. Desmond, you look like hell.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Have you heard anything from the girl staying with me, Anne Marie?

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Not a damn thing.  What's going on?  Mr. Meyerling was here, all steamed up, looking for you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Look, Neff, I've got Ben Corbett with me --

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: -- Here?!  Where's Wilder?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Back at my place... he, uh, broke his leg.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: If Corbett's men find out --

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: -- I'm putting him on the plane to Fairbanks, eleven tomorrow.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Jiminy Christmas.  What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Corbett ruined my two-way.  Go to my place on the Haul Road, tell Anne Marie I'm okay and to sit tight.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Just stay out of my face until I'm gone!

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: I was just on my way to your ladyfriend's, but I guess she found you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Yeah.  Sorry I barked at you last night.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: I'm the one should be sorry... Goddamn Kenai, always out for a score.  I never should've let him go over there.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Look, Mr. Desmond, I didn't count on it turning this ugly.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Bastards killed Sam, you think they won't kill the rest of us?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: There'll be three, four men at the most.  I have some backup, nothing will happen.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: I'm real sorry.  In a while, you're gone from this country. But we live here.  No one wants to mix it up with those hombres.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You don't care enough about Sam to --

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: -- Sam Wilder was my cousin. He's why I came to Alaska.  All his letters, saying what a paradise it is.  But me ending up dead won't do Sam a lick of good.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Neff, you know better than this...

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: You're an outsider, Mr. Desmond. Step aside; stay out of it.

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: Alleged killer.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: What does this matter to you?

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: You can't see past your lousy little assignment, sniffing around the pipeline.  The few voters there are in this district look up to Corbett, and I'm not about to alienate them.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I should release Corbett because you want some votes?

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: This miserable wilderness is a state of the union.  Policy's made here the same way as in the civilized world: at the ballot box.  That's the beauty of it -- these icebox cowboys are living a century too late.  Get them on your side, it's like buying Manhattan for beads.  With a handful of votes you control the greatest frontier since white men stumbled onto the New World.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Some day these people'll wake up, and you'll be the first one they'll run out of here.

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: Nobody wants any more killings; we all agree to that, correct?  That's good.  Now, Eric, you're gonna hand your prisoner over to us.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: MEYERLING
turns.text: This isn't your concern.  It's over, here and now.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Bet you're right.  But I didn't come by to wangle a meal --

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: -- We appreciate the company. Anne Marie's getting cabin fever already.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: What'd you say they call these spaceships?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Mobile Arctic Dwelling -- MAD.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Hey, Sam, look over there.  Black and white smoke.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Damn.  Likely that's an SOS. Have to pass on that lunch.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: We'll go with you.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: I'm too old for this shit.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Any idea who could've done it?

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: ...You give us a ride in the Cessna you got hangared at the pumping station, we'll be in Fairbanks in a few hours.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: That's what we should've done in the first place.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: I could've sat tight for the transport, 'til Bob came poking around.
